demos.passage: The extramural research goals below should be considered at the time research projects are being developed. For further guidance on selecting goals, see the Select Goals page. Researchers are encouraged to identify priority goals for extramural research as a part of their application.
demos.claims: 1. The extramural research goals below should be considered at the time research projects are being developed.

demos.passage: Note: Positive CRP results also occur during the last half of pregnancy or with the use of birth control pills (oral contraceptives).
demos.claims: 1. Positive CRP results also occur during the last half of pregnancy or with the use of birth control pills (oral contraceptives).

demos.passage: Health Tips: Basic steps like washing hands and not touching your face can go a long way.
demos.rationale: produce the claims. We can start by...
demos.claims: 1. Wash your hands frequently. 2. Don't touch your face. 3. Avoid close contact with people who are sick.

demos.passage: Talk to your pediatrician about any challenges or issues you or baby may be having, but after the first couple of months pass, most new parents can become pros at feeding, changing diapers and ensuring their infant is sleeping properly.
demos.rationale: produce the claims. We know that the first couple of months are challenging for new parents. We also know that after the first couple of months, most new parents can become pros at feeding, changing diapers and ensuring their infant is sleeping properly. We can infer that the first couple of months are challenging for new parents because they are not pros at feeding, changing diapers and ensuring their
demos.claims: The first couple of months are challenging for new parents. After the first couple of months, most new parents can become pros at feeding, changing diapers and ensuring their infant is sleeping properly.

demos.passage:
What works for one baby may not work for another. Other suggestions include the following:
- Make sure your baby is not hungry, but do not force feed if he or she is not interested in the bottle or breast.
- Change your baby's position. Sit him or her up if lying down. Let your baby face forward if you are carrying or holding him/her facing your chest. Babies like to see different views of the world.
- Give your baby interesting things to look at: different shapes, colors, textures, and sizes.
- Talk to your baby. Sing softly to your baby.
- Rock your baby.
- Walk your baby.
- Swaddle your baby in a blanket.
- Place your baby in an infant swing on a slow setting.
- Let your baby lay on his or her belly on your lap, and softly rub his or her back.
- Go for a ride in the car. The motion of the car often soothes babies.
- Try using something in your child's room that makes a repetitive sound, such as a fan, a wind-up alarm clock, or heartbeat CD. The sound of a vacuum or washing machine may also soothe a fussy baby.
- Hold and cuddle your baby. Babies cannot be spoiled by too much attention. However, they can have problems later in life if they are ignored and their needs are not met as infants.
- Try using a pacifier.
- Let an adult family member or friend (or a responsible babysitter) care for your baby from time to time so that you can take a break. Taking care of yourself and lowering your stress level may help your baby as well..
demos.facts: ["What works for one baby may not work for another.", "Make sure your baby is not hungry, but do not force feed if they are not interested in the bottle or breast.", "Change your baby's position, such as sitting them up if they are lying down or letting them face forward if held against your chest.", "Give your baby interesting things to look at, such as different shapes, colors, textures, and sizes.", "Talk to your baby and sing softly to them.", "Rock your baby.", "Walk your baby.", "Swaddle your baby in a blanket.", "Place your baby in an infant swing on a slow setting.", "Let your baby lay on their belly on your lap and softly rub their back.", "Go for a ride in the car to soothe your baby.", "Use something in your child's room that makes a repetitive sound, such as a fan, wind-up alarm clock, or heartbeat CD, or the sound of a vacuum or washing machine to soothe a fussy baby.", "Hold and cuddle your baby, as they cannot be spoiled by too much attention.", "Try using a pacifier.", "Allow an adult family member, friend, or responsible babysitter to care for your baby occasionally to give yourself a break and reduce stress, which may help your baby."]

demos.passage: These preliminary data suggest that the SARS-CoV-2 B.1.526 variant does not cause more severe disease. In NYC, evidence does not indicate a higher reinfection rate among persons infected with B.1.526 viruses carrying the E484K mutation compared with those with infections without the mutation, although this might reflect incomplete case ascertainment during early 2020 because of limited testing capacity. Whereas a slightly larger proportion of persons infected with the B.1.526 variant carrying the E484K mutation had a previous positive antibody test than those infected with B.1.526 without the mutation, the difference is not significant, and data are insufficient to conclude that there is an increased risk for reinfection. Laboratory studies of B.1.526 variants carrying the E484K mutation showed that vaccine-induced antibodies against this virus had decreased neutralizing activity and that certain monoclonal antibodies had impaired activity§ (3). Additional evaluations in human populations are required to assess immune evasion of B.1.526.
demos.facts: ["Preliminary data suggest that the SARS-CoV-2 B.1.526 variant does not cause more severe disease.", "In NYC, there is no evidence indicating a higher reinfection rate among persons infected with the B.1.526 variant carrying the E484K mutation compared with those infected with the B.1.526 variant without the E484K mutation.", "The lack of evidence for a higher reinfection rate might reflect incomplete case ascertainment during early 2020 due to limited testing capacity.", "A slightly larger proportion of persons infected with the B.1.526 variant carrying the E484K mutation had a previous positive antibody test compared to those infected with the B.1.526 variant without the E484K mutation.", "The difference in previous positive antibody tests between those with and without the E484K mutation is not significant.", "Data are insufficient to conclude that there is an increased risk for reinfection with the B.1.526 variant carrying the E484K mutation.", "Laboratory studies showed that vaccine-induced antibodies had decreased neutralizing activity against the B.1.526 variant carrying the E484K mutation.", "Certain monoclonal antibodies had impaired activity against the B.1.526 variant carrying the E484K mutation.", "Additional evaluations in human populations are required to assess immune evasion of the B.1.526 variant."]

demos.passage: If you are a man, you may need this test if:\n- You've been unable to get your partner pregnant after 12 months of trying.\n- Your sex drive is decreased..
demos.facts: ["Men may need this test if they have been unable to get their partner pregnant after 12 months of trying.", "Men may need this test if their sex drive is decreased."]

demos.passage: Doctors use certain milestones to tell if a baby is developing as expected. There's a wide range of what's considered normal, so some babies gain skills earlier or later than others. Babies who were born prematurely may reach milestones later. Always talk with your doctor about your baby's progress.
demos.facts: ["Doctors use certain milestones to assess if a baby is developing as expected.", "There is a wide range of what is considered normal for reaching developmental milestones.", "Some babies gain skills earlier or later than others.", "Babies who were born prematurely may reach milestones later.", "Always talk with your doctor about your baby's progress."]

demos.passage: At this point, you probably know the signs that your baby is hungry or full. When hungry, your baby may seem restless, cry, stick out their tongue, or suck on their hands and lips. When full, your baby probably doesn't seem interested in feeding or just falls asleep after feeding.
demos.facts: ["Signs that a baby is hungry include restlessness, crying, sticking out their tongue, and sucking on their hands and lips.", "When full, a baby likely doesn't seem interested in feeding or falls asleep after feeding."]

demos.passage: Get the right amount of calories for you: You need more calories while you’re breastfeeding than you did before you were pregnant. Use the MyPlate Plan tool to find out how many calories you need at each stage of breastfeeding. Then work with your doctor to find a healthy eating routine that works for you.
demos.facts: ["You need more calories while breastfeeding than before pregnancy.", "The MyPlate Plan tool can help determine how many calories you need at each stage of breastfeeding.", "You should work with your doctor to find a healthy eating routine while breastfeeding."]

demos.passage: Weaning in One Step: The longer a child uses a bottle, the harder it may be for them to give it up. If your child can already drink from a cup but refuses to do so or refuses to give up the bottle, you might have to take away all bottles completely at one time. This method applies to children 15 to 18 months and older who use the bottle for comfort or habit and not for food.
demos.facts: ["The longer a child uses a bottle, the harder it may be for them to give it up.", "If a child can already drink from a cup but refuses to do so or refuses to give up the bottle, you might need to take away all bottles completely at one time.", "The one-step weaning method applies to children 15 to 18 months and older who use the bottle for comfort or habit and not for food."]

demos.passage: You likely will have a breast exam. In some cases, you may need to have an imaging test of your breast. Breast imaging can be done with mammography, an ultrasound exam, or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI). Imaging may be followed by a biopsy.
demos.facts: ["You will likely have a breast exam.", "In some cases, you may need to have an imaging test of your breast.", "Breast imaging can be performed using mammography.", "Breast imaging can be performed using an ultrasound exam.", "Breast imaging can be performed using magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).", "Imaging may be followed by a biopsy."]

demos.passage: Nationwide, 6.5% of students reported that they had been pregnant or had gotten someone else pregnant. Overall, female students (8.5%) were significantly more likely to have been pregnant than male students (4.7%) were to have gotten someone else pregnant. This significant difference was identified for white students and students in grade 12. Overall, black students (14.9%) were significantly more likely than Hispanic and white students (7.1% and 4.5%, respectively) to have been pregnant or to have gotten someone else pregnant. This significant difference was identified for both male and female students. Hispanic male students (6.3%) were significantly more likely than white male students (3.0%) to have gotten someone else pregnant. Female students in grade 12 (11.1%) were significantly more likely than female students in grade 9 (5.1%) to have been pregnant. Prevalence rates ranged from 3.5% to 12.1% (median: 5.7%) across the state surveys and from 4.6% to 19.5% (median: 10.2%) across the local surveys (Table_29).
demos.facts: ["Nationwide, 6.5% of students reported that they had been pregnant or had gotten someone else pregnant.", "Female students (8.5%) were significantly more likely to have been pregnant than male students (4.7%) were to have gotten someone else pregnant.", "The significant difference in pregnancy rates was identified for white students and students in grade 12.", "Black students (14.9%) were significantly more likely than Hispanic students (7.1%) and white students (4.5%) to have been pregnant or to have gotten someone else pregnant.", "The significant difference in pregnancy rates was identified for both male and female students.", "Hispanic male students (6.3%) were significantly more likely than white male students (3.0%) to have gotten someone else pregnant.", "Female students in grade 12 (11.1%) were significantly more likely than female students in grade 9 (5.1%) to have been pregnant.", "Prevalence rates for being pregnant or getting someone else pregnant ranged from 3.5% to 12.1% (median: 5.7%) across state surveys.", "Prevalence rates ranged from 4.6% to 19.5% (median: 10.2%) across local surveys."]

demos.passage: Soon after, Rani began oral immunotherapy for two additional allergens – sesame and cashew. This time however, she was allowed to receive her up-doses at CHOP Specialty Care, Princeton at Plainsboro, closer to her family’s home. There, Rani’s OIT is overseen by Rahul Datta, MD, PhD, an Attending Physician with the Food Allergy Center and the Division of Allergy and Immunology.
demos.facts: ["Rani began oral immunotherapy for sesame and cashew allergens.", "Rani received her up-doses at CHOP Specialty Care, Princeton at Plainsboro.", "CHOP Specialty Care, Princeton at Plainsboro is closer to Rani's family's home.", "Rani's oral immunotherapy is overseen by Rahul Datta, MD, PhD.", "Rahul Datta is an Attending Physician with the Food Allergy Center and the Division of Allergy and Immunology."]

demos.passage: Which children are at risk for X-linked agammaglobulinemia: Women who are carriers have a 1 in 2 chance of passing the faulty X chromosome to a child. This is true for every pregnancy. If a daughter gets the gene, she will likely be a healthy carrier like her mother. If a son gets the gene, he will have X-linked agammaglobulinemia.
demos.facts: ["Women who are carriers of the faulty X chromosome have a 1 in 2 chance of passing the faulty X chromosome to a child in every pregnancy.",  "Daughters of X chromosome woman carriers will likely be a healthy carrier.", "Sons of X chromosome woman carriers will have X-linked agammaglobulinemia"]

demos.passage:
Feeding Your Baby Expand All:
- Breastfeeding—feeding directly from the breast—works for some moms. For others, feeding a baby pumped breast milk with a bottle is another very good option. Some moms cannot or choose not to breastfeed or pump. They feed their babies formula. Some moms choose a combination of feeding methods.
- Talk with your health care professional about which way is best for you. Remember that the decision is a personal one. Feeding your baby should be enjoyable and comfortable for both of you.
- Breastfeeding has a lot of benefits for moms and babies. Breast milk helps the baby resist diseases and allergies. Breastfeeding is also cheaper than bottle-feeding and may help you return to your prepregnancy weight more quickly. Even breastfeeding only for a few weeks or months has health benefits for the baby.
- If you breastfeed, don't be surprised if breastfeeding starts off slowly. Some new moms breastfeed without any problems. For others, breastfeeding can be a challenge. Both you and the baby need to learn together and get comfortable. If the baby calms down after breastfeeding, makes urine, and is growing, the baby is getting enough milk. Read Breastfeeding Your Baby to learn more, and talk with your health care professional if you need help.
- When you go back to school or work, you can still feed your baby breast milk. You can get a breast pump to collect and store milk. Your school or workplace should have a place where you can do this.
demos.facts: ["Breastfeeding, or feeding directly from the breast, works for some moms.", "Feeding a baby pumped breast milk with a bottle is another good option for some moms.", "Some moms cannot or choose not to breastfeed or pump and instead feed their babies formula.", "Some moms choose a combination of breastfeeding and formula feeding.", "Talk with your health care professional about the best feeding method for you.", "Feeding your baby should be enjoyable and comfortable for both you and your baby.", "Breastfeeding has benefits for both moms and babies.", "Breast milk helps the baby resist diseases and allergies.", "Breastfeeding is cheaper than bottle-feeding and may help you return to your prepregnancy weight more quickly.", "Even breastfeeding for a few weeks or months has health benefits for the baby.", "Breastfeeding may start off slowly and can be a challenge for some new moms.", "Both you and the baby need to learn and get comfortable with breastfeeding.", "If the baby calms down after breastfeeding, makes urine, and is growing, the baby is getting enough milk.", "You can read 'Breastfeeding Your Baby' for more information and talk with your health care professional if you need help.", "You can still feed your baby breast milk when you return to school or work.", "You can use a breast pump to collect and store milk.", "Your school or workplace should have a place where you can pump breast milk."]

generate_claims.signature_instructions: You are given a passage and you must extract clear, unambiguous claims from the passage without adding additional information.
